comment: Dr. Ingram is very kind and is passionate about her class. She likes participation and is powerpoint heavy. She definitely encourages you to study other material outside of class other than the powerpoints. The material is heavy so be ready to study.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Seems like a great individual, but I had a hard time with her as a professor. Had lots of issues with getting clear instructions on big assignments. Also had a difficult time with communication. Responds promptly to emails, but if you ask a question in class it will be answered with another question and you'll leave more confused than you arrived.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Class was asynchronous online and easy class in general but a lot of online hw on MindTap that can take a while if you wait till the last minute like I did lol, but luckily 3 tries on each assignment. 4 quizzes on lockdown that were 60 q's but can find them on quizlet. Discussions mandatory but easy. Recommend her for lower level ES classes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Where to begin. I suggest avoiding dr Ingram for any upper level course in the ES department. Very unorganized lectures, and unreliable grading. We would spend forever on topics and then rush to have to finish things on time. She genuinely is a nice person but not a good professor at all
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Ingram is very lenient and gives a lot of extended time to complete work. All the work is given off Mindtap which is easy to use and learn. Professor Ingram is very fast at responding to students and gives extra credit. Discussion posts and you'll have to answer other students. Very easy and such a great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: This class was completely online and on our own time for the most part. She was very responsive when I emailed her with any questions. She also gave ample extra credit opportunities. As long as you do the work, you will get a good grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy class just a lot of online homework which doesn't take a long.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Ingram is the BEST!! Take her!! Even though the class was online she was always there and in-touch with the students. Super helpful and interesting content. There are 4 Quizzes and Weekly Mindtap assignments. Plenty of Extra Credit Opportunities and one Final Discussion Project. If you keep up with the readings it is very easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: Such a sweet person, I'd definitely love to have her again ! Very understanding and quick to respond to emails. This class was pretty easy ! Get your work in on time and put some effort in and you're good !
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Ingarm is an amazing professor. Although the class was online it never felt so as she was always there to help you out and responds to emails quickly. The content is super informative and interesting. The assignments paired are great as they help practice for the exams too. Weekly mindtap assignments, 4 tests, and 1 discussion post project.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took Dr. Ingram for Principles of Nutrition and it was a solid choice. Modules every 2 weeks. As long as you complete those you should be fine. The tests were a little harder, but as long as you read the modules and study you should be fine. I got a low A on every test. There is a final discussion post. No cumulative final, just 4 tests. Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took Dr. Ingram online for summer. Nutrition summer course had 4 overall "tests"; one each week for each module. The rest were MindTap assignments that took a lot of time to complete; however, it helps you learn the content! Read the book! Take notes! Easy class if you put in the work. She is super kind, respectful, & cares for your well being!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Ingram has been one of the best professors I've had at KSU. She is extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the content. Dr. Ingram is very caring and understanding when it comes to students' grades. Due to COVID, med terminology (summer four week I session) was taken online with several worksheets and quizzes a week. The kindest :)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I loved taking Prof. Ingram's nutrition class. I thought it would just be about how to eat. It was a lot about that but more about the science. I took it the same semester as A&P and these went great together. There were assignments, but not lectures, which I like. I asked for help and Prof Ingram is super smart and gave lots of extra credit.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was way tougher than I thought it would be. I had to put in a lot of work just to get a B. However, Dr. Ingram herself definitely cares about our success and gave us multiple opportunities for extra credit. I won't sugar coat it, the class is challenging. Dr. Ingram is a great professor though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: It's clear that Dr. Ingram is passionate about this course. She puts a lot of effort into teaching this class and really cares that you understand the material... and she expects the same amount of effort in return. You won't do well if you don't put in the effort. Also, I recommend taking anatomy or a biochem class before this if you can. It helps
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I had her for Aging and thought it was one of the best classes in the major. Her lectures are different- she asked questions and made us think about what we were learning. She gave assignments and bonus points and that helped me understand things better. If you want a good grade, do your work, show up for class, and get the bonus points.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Dr. Ingram is nice and passionate about teaching. However, how she makes Aging & Disease (a common sense, straightforward class) more difficult than what it needs to be is far beyond my understanding. Her answer choices on exams are EXTREMELY detailed and unnecessary. Also, this was mostly a research class that took a lot of outside work.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: One of the worst professors I have ever had. Not understanding in the slightest. Ask for help and she will just tell you to study. Tests are impossible. Dr. Ingram literally could care less if you fail or not. DO NOT TAKE HER EVER or you will cry everyday
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is the one of the nicest people in the major, but avoid if possible. Not a great professor and seems clueless on information presented. Often avoids tough questions. Picky grader and test are extremely hard. I had her for Ex. Phys and Aging, 2 years apart and no change. Only took her because I had to. Good grade because I memorized PowerPoints.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Ingram is an online teacher and takes, on average, 2 weeks to reply. She also is a picky grader. I would spend a lot of time on discussions and she would find ways to take away points. I heard she is very hard for Ex Phys as well from people taking her. Final is cumulative. I would not take her again. Very frustrating class with her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Ingram is a brilliant woman, but not a very good professor. There are only 4 tests for Ex. Phys so watch out. She seems clueless and is always contradicting her power points and tests with what she says. She puts essentially identical questions on her tests that were in her power point but with different answers. She is condescending too
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is super nice and reminds me of a soccer mom, she is very passionate about nutrition and wants to influence you to make better eating habits. You have to read to get all the information she wants you to know, especially if you are filling out learning objects. Her questions are not always straightforward, 3 projects, and pop quizzes at random.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Ingram isn't a bad teacher, the material is hard and you have to work for your grade. Unfortunately, there are other teachers at KSU that make this course a lot easier. If you're a good test taker than you'll do fine in this course. Luckily Dr. Ingram does care about her students and will work with them to get the grade they want.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Only grades you have come from 4 tests, 3 reg then a cumulative final. Reads mostly off PowerPoints. Offers an extra credit point here or there based on random questions at the beginning of class but not enough to do much. Need to use book and be able to teach yourself bc test questions are ridiculously difficult. Recommend taking different prof.

Here's how to get an A in this class. Get all the bonus points possible. She gives a LOT of bonus point opportunities. Go to class. She stresses the important stuff there. Read the powerpoints to do well on the tests.

She is a wonderful professor. She wants to see her students succeed and does everything she can to make sure it happens. Her lectures may be boring but she provides everything you need for an A in her classes. you just have to put in the effort. She is easy to talk to and is not intimating like some of the other professors. She is a very sweet lady

She was very helpful an understanding but her class is boring. She reads from the power point and is somewhat mono tone. If you just study the objectives for each chapter, you will pass. Attendance is not mandatory but she gives a pop quiz about once every two weeks.

She is very careing and wants her students to do well. She may not be as exciting as most  student wants her to be  but deep down she is amazing.Talk to her about issues, read the textbook you will good. I didn't do as well as i wanted but she gave me all chance in the world! She is always different from the rest in the ESH department.

She is very nice and helpful, but class is very boring. Reads straight from powerpoint. Textbook is necassary. Tests cover a bunch of material. Gives pop quizes often, but are a good way to bring grades up.
